project.teaser: Buildings are responsible for approximately 40% of energy consumption and 36% of CO2 emissions in the EU. Deep Renovation of existing old buildings has the potential to lead to significant energy savings and a tremendous carbon footprint shrinkage. The current EU climate...
project.objective: Buildings are responsible for approximately 40% of energy consumption and 36% of CO2 emissions in the EU. Deep Renovation of existing old buildings has the potential to lead to significant energy savings and a tremendous carbon footprint shrinkage. The current EU climate targets open an ample opportunity for exponential growth in the building thermal insulation materials market owing to the increasing number of new residential buildings and current deep renovation needs. The target is to support residential buildings construction performance extraordinary at all three hierarchical levels of construction parts simultaneously (building, component, material) by creating an amplified environmental impact and reducing additionally VOC emissions. BIO4EEB will apply non-hazardous bio-based material as e.g., Posidonia and various bio-based foams to develop and to proof the marketability of smart components for external and internal use as material application, pre-fab panels or windows. The efficiency and effectiveness is quite important to match with market demands and establish a unique selling proposition including a seven years RoI! BIO4EEB will close the increasing gap of insulation material shortage caused by the regular growing demand and the mismatch caused by lacking production potential and the outcome of the current energy crisis by boosting the use of available bio-based qualified materials as alternative solutions. The objective is to substitute using fossil resources for components and replace them at a comparable price value positioning. New business models utilizing the complete economic value chain open the market for bio-based BIO4EEB solutions and products uplifting the generic bio-based material use and qualifying their application at a circular economy approach for creating a much greener EU building and construction industry real estate stock.
project.title: BIO insulation materials for Enhancing the Energy performance of Buildings.
project.keywords: Energy consumption, CO2 emissions, non-hazardous, bio-based materials, cost-effectiveness

article.title: Innovative bio-based insulation materials support a greener building and construction industry

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BIO4EEB (BIO insulation materials for Enhancing the Energy performance of Buildings.)
result.teaser: The BIO4EEB project is driven by the urgent need to enhance energy efficiency in buildings, aligning with EU climate goals. Buildings account for 40% of energy consumption and 36% of CO2 emissions in the EU, yet renovation rates have been insufficient to meet policy objectives...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation report (2nd version).
result.description: For maximizing the impact of the project a detailed Plan for the Dissemination and Communication activities will be developed by M6, which will be renewed at M18, M30 and M42. Each period is the subject of an assessment to increase the effectiveness of the next plan. The first action will be to detail the needs of the project in terms of C&D. Related tasks: 6.1.

result.title: Training plan and report (1st version).
result.description: In order to raise awareness about the innovative BIO4EEB solutions, a series of training events and material will be generated during the project. The deliverable will contain the training plan and the necessary material for its complete understanding. Related tasks: 6.3.

result.title: Assessment of circularity for the developed solutions (1st version).
result.description: Through an analysis carried out in a quality evaluation and sign tool to measure the circularity of the materials introduced in the renovation process, deliverable will show the parameterized qualities of the products. A certification model will also be developed to assess the circularity of the products used in the rehabilitation actions. Related tasks: 4.6.

result.title: BIO4EEB application in virtual demo cases (1st version).
result.description: Deliverable will show all the work developed in the different virtual demos in order to assess the applicability of each developed solution, evaluate the result, identify the technical barriers to its implementation as well as possible financing schemes. It will also be shown thanks to the virtual demo, the comparison between the current and future behavior of end users. Different versions of the Deliverable will be generated as the project progresses. Related tasks: 4.3.

result.title: Technological, building and manufacturing context report (final version).
result.description: Revision: Requirements established by the national and international construction regulations of the different countries and those related to the application of biologically based materials will be analyzed in this deliverable. A standardized approach will be identified and developed to collect and balance needs to create a digital inventory and specific guidelines to ensure the application of biobased materials and components. Related tasks:2.1.

result.title: Training plan and report (2nd version).
result.description: In order to raise awareness about the innovative BIO4EEB solutions, a series of training events and material will be generated during the project. The deliverable will contain the training plan and the necessary material for its complete understanding. Related tasks: 6.3.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation report (1st version).
result.description: For maximizing the impact of the project a detailed Plan for the Dissemination and Communication activities will be developed by M6, which will be renewed at M18, M30 and M42. Each period is the subject of an assessment to increase the effectiveness of the next plan. The first action will be to detail the needs of the project in terms of C&D. Related tasks: 6.1.

result.title: Socio-economic assessment and end users' segmentation.
result.description: The third deliverable of WP2 will describe the early analysis, characterization and segmentation of the final users of the buildings, according to a series of economic, socioeconomic and cultural factors. The stakeholders of the value chain of the promotion or rehabilitation of residential buildings are the main promoters and beneficiaries of the energy efficiency measures implemented. User behavior analysis will consist of interviews, user comfort surveys and follow-up data collection, which will be used to reduce the performance gap between predicted and actual energy consumption of buildings. Related tasks: 2.2.

result.title: Demo-case contextualisation Report.
result.description: Deliverable will identify the customer value proposition, profit formula, key resources and processes from the business cases against the actual demo cases. Related tasks: 4.1.

result.title: Technical market application report.
result.description: The deliverable will describe The mapping of application potential of bio-based solutions including Thorough technical evaluation of the properties of the preselected bio-based materials and their comparison with standard thermal insulating reference materials such as polystyrene, mineral fiber and polyurethane foam. It is important to monitor the in-situ behavior of these materials in real time and different climatic conditions. Related tasks: 2.4.

result.title: BIO4EEB Brand, website and social media (2nd version).
result.description: By M6, BIO4EEB visual identity package shall be designed and include among others logo, report templates, editable leaflet, editable roll-up, newsletter templates, slide deck (etc.). The project website is in English and set up within M6. It will be maintained for at least 24 months after the end of the project. The website is regularly updated in terms of contents and usability. All partners cooperate in areas of content provision and site population. R2M proactively proposes contents thanks to the continuous interaction with the partners and with the target audiences. Related tasks: 6.1.

result.title: BIO4EEB Brand, website and social media (3rd version).
result.description: By M6, BIO4EEB visual identity package shall be designed and include among others logo, report templates, editable leaflet, editable roll-up, newsletter templates, slide deck (etc.). The project website is in English and set up within M6. It will be maintained for at least 24 months after the end of the project. The website is regularly updated in terms of contents and usability. All partners cooperate in areas of content provision and site population. R2M proactively proposes contents thanks to the continuous interaction with the partners and with the target audiences. Related tasks: 6.1.

result.title: Technological, building and manufacturing context report (1st version).
result.description: Requirements established by the national and international construction regulations of the different countries and those related to the application of biologically based materials will be analyzed in this deliverable. A standardized approach will be identified and developed to collect and balance needs to create a digital inventory and specific guidelines to ensure the application of biobased materials and components. Related tasks:2.1.

result.title: BIO4EEB Brand, website and social media (1st version).
result.description: By M6, BIO4EEB visual identity package shall be designed and include among others logo, report templates, editable leaflet, editable roll-up, newsletter templates, slide deck (etc.). The project website is in English and set up within M6. It will be maintained for at least 24 months after the end of the project. The website is regularly updated in terms of contents and usability. All partners cooperate in areas of content provision and site population. R2M proactively proposes contents thanks to the continuous interaction with the partners and with the target audiences. result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation report (3rd version).
result.description: For maximizing the impact of the project a detailed Plan for the Dissemination and Communication activities will be developed by M6, which will be renewed at M18, M30 and M42. Each period is the subject of an assessment to increase the effectiveness of the next plan. The first action will be to detail the needs of the project in terms of C&D. Related tasks: 6.1.

result.title: BIO4EEB market analysis (1st version).
result.description: As part of the crucial inputs for effectively positioning the results within the target markets, SOLINTEL characterizes the needs of the end user segments potentially interested in energy efficient refurbishments as covered in T2.2. In addition to this, current and future competing solutions will be analyzed. Thanks to this analysis, crucial insights are obtained in terms of competitively pricing the BIO4EEB results. In this deliverable, a detailed market analysis will be carried out for the new products of the project.

result.title: Renovation evaluation metrics survey.
result.description: Applying the building project phase oriented 4M analysis process -Mapping, Modelling, Making, Monitoring- the essential KPIs are identified that focus on technical, environmental and economic criteria. Related tasks: 2.3.

category.title: business models
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/business models

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
